footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.108:1) Narrated Anas رضي الله عنه: When the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم was made to ascend to the heavens. He صلى الله عليه وسلم said (after his return), "I came upon a river (in Paradise) the banks of which were made of tents of hollow pearls. I asked Jibrîl (Gabriel), ‘What is this (river)?’ He replied, ‘This is the Kauthar’ " (Sahih Al-Bukhâri, Vol.6, Hadîth No. 488).

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muḥammad], al-Kawthar.
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. Verily, We have granted you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) Al-Kauthar (a river in Paradise).[3]
translations.english_rwwad: We have surely given you [O Prophet] Al-Kauthar [abundance],

translations.english_saheeh: So pray to your Lord and offer sacrifice [to Him alone].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therefore turn in prayer to your Lord and sacrifice (to Him only).
translations.english_rwwad: so pray and sacrifice to your Lord alone.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [2002]- From all good in this world and the Hereafter.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.108:3) Narrated Anas رضي الله عنه : The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "None of you will have Faith till he loves me more than his father, his children and all mankind. (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.1, Hadith No.14).

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off.[2002]
translations.english_hilali_khan: For he who hates you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم), he will be cut off (from posterity and every good thing in this world and in the Hereafter).[4]
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, the one who hates you is truly cut off [from all goodness].
